channel.title: Would the majority of you call this a good or reasonable computer?
channel.description:
Well, I got a new computer about a week ago, and I'm really satisfied with it :D
I'm just wondering what is good with it and what is not good with it etc.
I mainly use it for gaming ;)
Runs Warhammer Online smoothly, Assassins Creed, Fallout 3 etc.
Alright, so here are the specs:
OS: Windows Vista Home Premium 32bit
RAM: 4GB DDR2
CPU: Intel Core 2 Quad Q8200 @ 2.33GHz
Video: nVidia GeForce 9800GT 512mb RAM
Optical Drive: CD/DVD-RW
Hard Drive: SAMSUNG ATA 1Tb
Screen: BenQ 22"W' Monitor FullHD HDMI - E2200HD - 2ms

item.title: Would the majority of you call this a good or reasonable computer?
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

Yes, the partition table takes up quite a bit of space.

Read full topic
item.source: Would the majority of you call this a good or reasonable computer?

item.title: Would the majority of you call this a good or reasonable computer?
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:20, topic:272235”][quote author=cooper link=topic=359168.msg2741682#msg2741682 date=1239396585]

Hard Drive: SAMSUNG ATA 1Tb (916 GB to be spesific, rip off :P)

thats because 1TB is 1,000,000,000,000 bytes
1 gigabyte is 1,024,000,000 so you see why that doesnt add up?

Actually, a gigabyte is 1,000,000,000 bytes, or 10^9 bytes. However, windows measures in GiB [giga binary byte], which is 1,073,741,824 bytes or 2^30 bytes.
Your hard drive is one Terabyte [10^12], not one tebibyte [2^40].

Then how come some drives have more space than others?

What do you mean? Sorry, I do not understand your question.
[/quote]
Well, there’s 1 tb drives with 931 gb, others might have more or less.
Why’s that?[/quote]

isnt that the space needed to “draw” the lines on the platters?

Read full topic
item.source: Would the majority of you call this a good or reasonable computer?

item.description:

thats because 1TB is 1,000,000,000,000 bytes
1 gigabyte is 1,024,000,000 so you see why that doesnt add up?

Actually, a gigabyte is 1,000,000,000 bytes, or 10^9 bytes. However, windows measures in GiB [giga binary byte], which is 1,073,741,824 bytes or 2^30 bytes.
Your hard drive is one Terabyte [10^12], not one tebibyte [2^40].

Then how come some drives have more space than others?
[/quote]
What do you mean? Sorry, I do not understand your question.[/quote]
Well, there’s 1 tb drives with 931 gb, others might have more or less.
Why’s that?

Read full topic

item.title: Would the majority of you call this a good or reasonable computer?
item.dc:creator: @boriz boriz
item.description:
@boriz wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:16, topic:272235”][quote author=sppt link=topic=359168.msg2741657#msg2741657 date=1239395500]

Hard Drive: SAMSUNG ATA 1Tb (916 GB to be spesific, rip off :P)

thats because 1TB is 1,000,000,000,000 bytes
1 gigabyte is 1,024,000,000 so you see why that doesnt add up?

Actually, a gigabyte is 1,000,000,000 bytes, or 10^9 bytes. However, windows measures in GiB [giga binary byte], which is 1,073,741,824 bytes or 2^30 bytes.
Your hard drive is one Terabyte [10^12], not one tebibyte [2^40].

Then how come some drives have more space than others?
[/quote]
i assume you mean 1tb drive measured in GB? well mine is 931GB but mine is just under 1 trillion bytes i think its something to do with the way they work out a gigabyte in bytes as in 1024 instead 1000[/quote]

I got 931 GB as well, formatted as NTFS under vista x64 ultimate (modded the hell out of those stupid services)

Read full topic
item.source: Would the majority of you call this a good or reasonable computer?

item.title: Would the majority of you call this a good or reasonable computer?
item.dc:creator: @PeterMan PeterMan
item.description:
@PeterMan wrote:

Well, this is actually not overpriced in Norway, but a regular price. But… when you see prices outside of Norway, it’s then you slap yourself in the face.

But I don’t think I would have saved much on getting one from another country, since we must pay a shitload to get stuff into Norway.

Example: My friend bought a new pair of shoes from England which cost 600 NOK ( 89.63 USD)
When he got them, he had to pay 1800 NOK (269.017 USD)

Sorry for using USD and England in the same sentence

Read full topic
item.source: Would the majority of you call this a good or reasonable computer?

I bought it for 7995 NOK (Norwegian Kroner) which is about 1,198.33 USD. (Not included screen)

And about Assassins Creed, I’m not sure.
